title: David Sinclair (footballer, born 1969)
text:
David Sinclair (born 6 October 1969) is a Scottish former <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played in <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defence</a>.
Career.
Sinclair made most of his career appearances at <a href="Raith%20Rovers%20F.C.">Raith Rovers</a>, where he picked up two <a href="Scottish%20First%20Division">Scottish First Division</a> title medals, plus a <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a> winner's medal. After making over 175 league appearances for Raith, Sinclair failed to make even half that at a number of other clubs, retiring in 2001.
After the League Cup victory Raith Rovers manager <a href="Jimmy%20Nicholl">Jimmy Nicholl</a> is quoted to have said "Even Davie Sinclair was crying and he's so tough he's got tattoos on his teeth".
Honours.
Raith Rovers
Personal life.
Sinclair was brought up in the village of <a href="Valleyfield%2C%20Fife">High Valleyfield</a>.
